com.example.charl.tdidoctorv2

Class Bluetooth

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.charl.tdidoctorv2.Bluetooth

  • public class Bluetooth
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to control all Bluetooth connection and data retrieval code.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean connect()
      Conneccts the application to the OBD-II adapter.
      boolean foundDevice()
      Determines whether or not a Bluetooth OBD-II device is connected.
      java.lang.String getBoost()
      Uses formula of (Boost = (Intake manifold absolute pressure) - (absolute barometric pressure)) and Bluetooth commands to retrieve current data
      br.ufrn.imd.obd.commands.ObdCommandGroup getObdCommands()
      Returns ObdCommandGroup with all relevant OBD commands
      java.lang.String getRPM()
      Uses Bluetooth to retrieve current vehicle engine RPM
      java.lang.String getSpeed()
      Gets current vehicle speed in RPM via Bluetooth
      java.lang.String getThrottlePosition()
      Uses Bluetooth to retrieve current throttle position percentage
      java.lang.String getTroubleCodes()
      Returns OBD-II trouble codes/PIDs using Bluetooth command
      void runEchoOffCommand()
      Disables echoing of data from OBD-II adapter
      void setupDevice()
      Initializes Bluetooth information in the application and checks if any valid OBD-II devices are currently connected to the phone.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setupDevice

        public void setupDevice()
        Initializes Bluetooth information in the application and checks if any valid OBD-II devices are currently connected to the phone.

      • foundDevice

        public boolean foundDevice()
        Determines whether or not a Bluetooth OBD-II device is connected.
        Returns:
        true if a device is connected, false otherwise

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Conneccts the application to the OBD-II adapter.
        Returns:
        true if connection established and valid, false otherwise

      • getObdCommands

        public br.ufrn.imd.obd.commands.ObdCommandGroup getObdCommands()
        Returns ObdCommandGroup with all relevant OBD commands
        Returns:
        ObdCommandGroup with necessary OBD commands for application

      • getRPM

        public java.lang.String getRPM()
        Uses Bluetooth to retrieve current vehicle engine RPM
        Returns:
        engine RPM as formatted string of "[1234] RPM"

      • getThrottlePosition

        public java.lang.String getThrottlePosition()
        Uses Bluetooth to retrieve current throttle position percentage
        Returns:
        Throttle position as a formatted string

      • getBoost

        public java.lang.String getBoost()
        Uses formula of (Boost = (Intake manifold absolute pressure) - (absolute barometric pressure)) and Bluetooth commands to retrieve current data
        Returns:
        String of formatted boost pressure in PSI

      • getSpeed

        public java.lang.String getSpeed()
        Gets current vehicle speed in RPM via Bluetooth
        Returns:
        Vehicle speed in MPH

      • runEchoOffCommand

        public void runEchoOffCommand()
        Disables echoing of data from OBD-II adapter

      • getTroubleCodes

        public java.lang.String getTroubleCodes()
        Returns OBD-II trouble codes/PIDs using Bluetooth command
        Returns:
        String formatted with OBD-II trouble codes
